title: Korean Inspired Ground Beef Bowl
description: Hearty rice bowl with a hint of spice. Best served with a side veggie.
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together brown sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil, red pepper flakes and ginger.
Heat vegetable oil in a large cast iron skillet over medium high heat.
Add garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, about 3-5 minutes, making sure to crumble the beef as it cooks; drain excess fat.
Stir in soy sauce mixture and green onions until well combined, allowing to simmer until heated through, about 2 minutes.
Serve immediately, garnished with green onion and sesame seeds, if desired.

title: Spicy Pork Bowl
description: Sweet and spicy pork with veggies and tasty dressing.

ingredients.name: Collard Greens
ingredients.preparation: ribs and stems removed, leaves sliced

instructions: Freeze pork tenderloin until firm around the edges, 30–45 minutes.

Combine chili paste, brown sugar, ginger, garlic, 2 Tbsp. soy sauce, and 2 tsp. sesame oil in a resealable plastic bag (or medium bowl if you aren’t feeling the plastic). Thinly slice pork with a long sharp knife. Add to marinade, seal bag, and knead to thoroughly coat. Let sit at least 10 minutes and up to 2 hours.

Heat 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. When oil is very hot, add half of pork in a single layer; season very lightly with salt. Cook, undisturbed, increasing heat to high if needed, until dark brown underneath, about 1 minute. Toss pork, breaking up with tongs or a wooden spoon, and continue to cook, tossing, until cooked through, about 1 minute more. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with another 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil and remaining pork (you may want to briefly remove skillet from heat when adding more oil so it doesn’t spatter). Wipe out skillet.

Heat remaining 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil in skillet over medium-high. Add carrots and cook in a single layer, undisturbed, until beginning to soften and brown underneath, about 2 minutes. Add collard greens and toss to wilt. Cook, tossing occasionally, until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 2 minutes.
Combine vinegar and remaining 1 Tbsp. soy sauce and ¼ tsp. sesame oil in a small bowl.
To serve, divide rice among bowls and arrange pork and vegetables over. Top each with some scallions and a spoonful of gochujang; drizzle with dressing.

title: Tiktok Mac and Cheese
description: Ultra cheesy, creamy baked mac and cheese with a crispy golden top—TikTok famous for a reason.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Cook cavatappi according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Combine all shredded cheeses in a bowl and divide half into another bowl. Set aside.
Combine garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper in a small bowl. Divide in half and set aside.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add half the seasoning mixture and flour. Stir until it becomes paste-like, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Add evaporated milk and whisk until thickened.
Add heavy cream and the remaining seasoning mixture. Mix until combined.
Whisk in Dijon mustard until thick.
Slowly add in half the cheese mixture, letting each addition melt before adding more.
Stir in cooked cavatappi until fully coated with cheese sauce.
Layer macaroni and reserved shredded cheese in the prepared baking dish. Repeat layers.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Broil for 2 minutes until the top is golden brown.

title: Penne Alla Vodka
description: A creamy, rich tomato-based pasta sauce with a splash of vodka for depth—easy, elegant comfort food.
instructions: Boil a generously salted pot of water for the penne and cook it al dente according to package directions.
Meanwhile, add the olive oil and butter to a skillet over medium heat. Sauté the onion for about 5 minutes until softened.
Add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds.
Add the vodka and let it bubble for about 30 seconds.
Stir in the tomato paste until the sauce is smooth.
Stir in the heavy cream and reduce heat to medium-low. Let the sauce warm and thicken, about 2–3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add fresh basil if using.
Toss the sauce with drained penne pasta. If needed, thin the sauce with a splash of pasta water before draining.
Serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese if desired.

title: Shelley's Favorite Chicken
description: Juicy, flavorful chicken breasts baked with a sweet and savory seasoning blend. A weeknight staple in Shelley's kitchen!
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Pound chicken to about 1.5cm (0.6") thickness using a rolling pin, mallet, or your fist for even cooking.
Mix together the seasoning ingredients in a small bowl.
Line a baking tray with foil and parchment paper. Place chicken breasts smooth-side down on tray.
Drizzle with about 1 tsp olive oil and rub over with fingers. Sprinkle with half of the seasoning mixture.
Flip chicken. Drizzle with remaining 1 tsp oil, rub with fingers, and sprinkle the rest of the seasoning on top.
Bake for about 18 minutes or until the surface is golden and internal temperature reaches 165°F/75°C.
Remove from oven and transfer to serving plates immediately.
Let rest for 3–5 minutes before serving. Garnish with chopped parsley if desired.

title: Roasted Tomato Soup
description: A cozy, roasted tomato soup enhanced with fennel, garlic, and a touch of cream. Perfect with grilled cheese on the side.

ingredients.name: Fennel
ingredients.preparation: cored and roughly chopped, fronds saved for garnish

ingredients.name: Thinned Creme Fraiche or Sour Cream

instructions: Preheat oven to 425ºF.
Place tomatoes, shallots, fennel, and garlic in a large baking dish. Add chicken fat and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 45–50 minutes until vegetables are deeply golden and soft.
Transfer roasted vegetables and juices to a medium pot. Carefully squeeze out garlic into the pot.
Cover with chicken stock and add bay leaf and smoked paprika.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes.
Remove bay leaf and blend soup until smooth. Return to pot over low heat.
Stir in heavy cream. Add more chicken stock to adjust consistency, if needed.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a drizzle of olive oil, thinned sour cream, black pepper, and fennel fronds.

title: Miso Glazed Salmon
description: A sweet and savory miso-glazed salmon with a delicious caramelized glaze and a moist, flaky interior. Perfect for any occasion.
instructions: Salt and pepper the salmon filets.
In a small bowl, combine miso paste, soy sauce, brown sugar, rice vinegar, and sesame oil. Whisk until smooth. Reserve 1 tablespoon of marinade.
Place salmon in a medium-sized bowl and pour marinade over it. Let marinate for 1-3 hours.
Preheat oven to 375ºF. In a large skillet, add salmon and discard the marinade.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the fish is opaque and nearly cooked through.
Brush the salmon with the reserved glaze and broil on high for 1-2 minutes, until the fish reaches an internal temperature of 125-130ºF.
Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds before serving, if desired.

title: Stuffed Peppers
description: Classic stuffed peppers filled with ground beef, rice, tomato sauce, and cheese make an easy weeknight supper.

ingredients.name: Bell Peppers
ingredients.preparation: cut in half from stem to bottom and cored

ingredients.name: Shredded Monterey Jack or Cheddar Jack Cheese

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F and set oven rack to middle position.
In a medium bowl, mash beef with 1 tsp salt and baking soda. Let sit for 20 minutes.
Line a 9x13-inch baking dish with foil if desired. Place peppers cut side up in the dish; drizzle with 1 tbsp oil and sprinkle with remaining ¼ tsp salt.
Roast peppers for about 20 minutes until slightly browned and tender-crisp.
Meanwhile, heat 2 tbsp oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
Add garlic and cook 1 minute more, stirring constantly.
Add ground beef mixture, chili powder, cumin, and oregano. Increase heat to medium-high and cook, breaking up meat, for 4 to 5 minutes.
Add tomato sauce, bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and cook uncovered for 2 to 3 minutes.
Stir in cooked rice and ¾ cup of cheese until melted. Remove from heat.
Spoon meat filling evenly into roasted peppers. Top with remaining ¾ cup cheese.
Roast filled peppers for 10 to 15 minutes until hot and cheese is melted and bubbling. Serve immediately.

title: Creamy Sausage Tortellini Soup
description: A rich and hearty soup with crumbled sausage, cheese tortellini, fresh kale, and a creamy tomato base. Comforting and easy to prepare for any night of the week.
instructions: In a large pot over medium-high heat, add the sausage. Cook and crumble until browned, then remove and set aside.
Add the chopped carrots and onion to the pot and sauté until tender.
Add the minced garlic and Italian seasoning; cook for 1 minute more.
Stir in the flour to coat the vegetables, then return the sausage to the pot.
Pour in the chicken broth and add the tomato paste; stir to combine.
Add the heavy cream and tortellini. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 7 minutes, or until the tortellini is tender.
Stir in the chopped kale just before serving and season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Chicken Parmesan
description: Crispy breaded chicken breasts topped with marinara sauce and melted mozzarella cheese, baked to perfection and served with fresh basil. A comforting Italian classic.

ingredients.name: Boneless Skinless Chicken Breasts
ingredients.preparation: cut in half horizontally to make 6 breast halves

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Butterfly chicken breasts by slicing each in half horizontally to make 6 thin pieces. Pat dry and season with salt and pepper.
In a shallow bowl, beat the eggs. In another shallow bowl, mix breadcrumbs, half of the parmesan cheese, and garlic powder.
Dip each chicken piece in the egg, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken for about 2 minutes per side, until golden but not fully cooked.
Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce in the bottom of a 9×13” baking dish. Arrange the chicken pieces on top.
Top each piece of chicken with a spoonful of marinara sauce, mozzarella cheese, and the remaining parmesan.
Bake for 10–15 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the chicken reaches 165°F internally.
Garnish with fresh chopped basil. Serve over cooked spaghetti with extra marinara, if desired.

title: Roasted Miso Broccoli
description: Crispy roasted broccoli tossed in a savory-sweet miso glaze made with mirin, maple syrup, and rice vinegar. An easy and flavorful side dish.

ingredients.name: Broccoli
ingredients.preparation: cut into florets (or use a 12oz/340g bag of pre-cut florets)

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Spread broccoli florets on a baking sheet and toss with 1 tablespoon of avocado oil. Optionally season with salt and pepper.
Roast in the oven for about 20 minutes, or until broccoli is lightly charred and tender.
Meanwhile, prepare the miso sauce: In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, bring mirin to a boil and let it boil for 1 minute to evaporate the alcohol.
Reduce heat to medium-low and whisk in the miso paste until mostly dissolved.
Add rice vinegar, 1 tablespoon avocado oil, and maple syrup. Bring back to a boil, whisking continuously until smooth.
Remove from heat and let the sauce rest while broccoli finishes roasting.
Transfer roasted broccoli to a serving bowl, pour the miso sauce over it, toss to coat, and serve hot.

title: Thai Red Curry
description: A flavorful and aromatic Thai red curry made with tender chicken, vibrant vegetables, and a rich coconut milk-based sauce infused with red curry paste, lemongrass, and Thai basil.
instructions: Sauté onion, ginger, and garlic in oil for one minute.
Add red curry paste and minced coriander stem. Sauté for 2–3 minutes until aromatic and oil begins to separate.
Add coconut milk, stock, lemon juice, brown sugar, fish sauce, and lemongrass stalk. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Add the chicken and simmer for 7–8 minutes until nearly cooked through.
Add the red bell pepper and zucchini when chicken is almost done. Cook for 2 more minutes until vegetables are just tender but still crisp.
Remove the lemongrass stalk. Stir in torn Thai basil leaves and serve.

title: Tex-Mex Restaurant Enchiladas
description: A comforting and authentic Tex-Mex meal featuring beef enchiladas with homemade sauce, served with Mexican rice and refried beans.

items.name: Apple Cider Vinegar or Distilled White Vinegar

instructions: For the rice: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add rice and stir constantly until it starts to turn golden.

Add tomato sauce and water. Stir in chili powder, tomato bouillon, garlic, and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer until water is absorbed (about 20 minutes). Fluff and rest 5–10 minutes before serving.
For the beans: Heat oil or lard in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and brown both sides, then smash with a fork.
Add beans, chili powder, cumin, oregano, and salt. Heat through, then mash to desired consistency. Add lime juice if using.
For the enchilada sauce: In a pot, heat oil and whisk in flour, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and cinnamon. Cook until fragrant and darkened.
Whisk in tomato paste and chicken broth until smooth. Simmer until thickened (5–7 minutes), then remove from heat. Stir in vinegar and season with salt and pepper.
For the filling: In a skillet, brown ground beef with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and salt. Stir in 1/2 cup enchilada sauce.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Pour a thin layer of sauce in a baking dish. Fill tortillas with beef, roll, and place seam side down.
Top with remaining sauce, then Monterey Jack and cheddar. Bake for 25 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Garnish enchiladas with cotija, sour cream, and cilantro. Serve with Mexican rice and refried beans.

title: Mapo Tofu
description: A bold and spicy Sichuan dish featuring silken tofu, ground pork, fermented bean paste, and toasted chilies in a rich, mouth-numbing sauce.

ingredients.name: Sichuan Peppercorns
ingredients.preparation: powdered or finely ground (reserve 1/4 tsp for garnish)

instructions: Heat a wok or small saucepan over low heat. Add half of the oil and both the fresh and dried chilies. Toast for about 5 minutes until fragrant, stirring occasionally. Be careful not to burn. Remove from heat and set aside.
In the same wok, heat the remaining oil over medium heat. Add the minced ginger and sauté for 1 minute. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Increase heat to high and add ground pork. Break it up and cook until fully browned.
Stir in the ground Sichuan peppercorns and cook for 15–30 seconds without burning.
Add the spicy bean sauce and stir well. Pour in the chicken broth and simmer for 1–2 minutes.
Mix the water and cornstarch in a small bowl. Stir the cornstarch slurry into the sauce and let it bubble until thickened.
Add the reserved chili oil (including the peppers, unless using pre-made chili oil, in which case use only the oil).
Gently stir in the tofu and cook for 3–5 minutes, tossing gently to coat.
Add the sesame oil and sugar (if using), along with the scallions. Stir until the scallions wilt.
Garnish with the reserved 1/4 tsp ground Sichuan peppercorns before serving.
